author: Austin Burkes
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Former Fox News personality and conservative commentator Tucker Carlson said the attempted assassination of Donald Trump “changed everything” and praised his response to it in a primetime speech on the final night of the Republican National Convention.{/p}{p}“Everything was different after that moment,” Carlson said of the shooting. “This convention is different, the nation is different, the world is different. Donald Trump is different.”{/p}{p}He also said Trump went through a transformation watching him raise his fist after he was shot at. Trump’s reaction to the shooting has earned repeated praise throughout the four days of the RNC with speakers praising his strength and encourage in the moment while others claimed his survival was a moment of divine intervention.{/p}{p}“He was no longer just a political party’s nominee, or a former president or a future president, this was the leader of a nation,” Carlson said.{/p}{p}{sd-embed data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Along with supporting Trump, Carlson also praised his running mate JD Vance, who he described as a friend and one of the few Washington lawmakers who is “very close to his own wife.”{br}{/p}{p}Fox fired Carlson last year without explanation in a decision that came less than a week after settling a lawsuit concerning the spread of lies about the 2020 presidential election that resulted in a record payout of $787 million.{/p}{p}After being let go from the network, Carlson started took his show to X, formerly known as Twitter, and{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/from-the-desk/former-fox-host-tucker-carlson-launching-his-own-streaming-network-network-staffed-fired-dominion-voting-systems-lawsuit-ratings-conversations-interviews#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/from-the-desk/former-fox-host-tucker-carlson-launching-his-own-streaming-network-network-staffed-fired-dominion-voting-systems-lawsuit-ratings-conversations-interviews#\"} launched his own streaming service {/a}where he airs interviews, documentaries and other programming. He has maintained a relationship with Trump, {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/politics/former-president-donald-trump-criticizes-cable-news-channels-blows-off-field-of-challengers-in-interview-with-tucker-carlson#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/politics/former-president-donald-trump-criticizes-cable-news-channels-blows-off-field-of-challengers-in-interview-with-tucker-carlson#\"}interviewing him {/a}on the night of the first Republican presidential primary debate.{/p}{p}Carlson also took apparent jabs at President Joe Biden, who is reportedly considering dropping out of the race amid growing Democratic discontent over his chances after a poor performance in the first debate skyrocketed concerns about his age and mental fitness.{/p}{p}“Just cause you call yourself the president doesn’t mean that much inherently. I can call my dog the CEO of Hewitt Packard, it doesn’t mean she is,” Carlson said. “You could take, I don’t know, a mannequin, a dead person and make him president. I’m just saying, theoretically possible.”
